span.breadcrumb_last,.tourbrd span,.tour-overview p, .tour-collection p,ul.highlight-this-tour li,.TourDates p,.pkg-inc ul li, .pkg-exc ul li,.tour-overview p b,h2.tourDBox,.sidebar_section_col ul li a {
    font-family: 'Roboto';
}

.TourDates p {
    font-size: 16px;
}

ul.highlight-this-tour li:before {
    content: "\f191";
    font: normal 14px/1 FontAwesome;
    color: #444;
    display: inline-block !important;
    width: 1em;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0 5px 0 0;
    text-align: center;
    font-variant: normal;
    text-transform: none;
    line-height: 1em;
    position: relative;
}
h2.tourDBox {
    font-weight: bold;
}
.TourList {
    border-left: dashed 1px #d8d8d8;
    border-radius: 0px;
    float: left;
    width: 100%;
    position: relative;
}
.TourDates:first-child {
    margin-top: 0;
    padding-top: 0;
}
.TourDates {
    margin: 15px 0 15px 0px;
    padding-top: 10px;
    margin-left: 20px;
    border-bottom: 1px solid #d8d8d8;
    font-size: 16px;
    cursor: pointer;
    display: block;
    color: #1F2225;
    float: left;
    width: 98%;
}
.TourDay_details {
    float: left;
    width: 85%;
    letter-spacing: 0.5px;
    word-spacing: 0.8px;
    line-height: normal;
    font-size: 14px;
}
.TourDay {
    color: #c00100;
    margin-right: 10px;
    float: left;
}
.expBut {
    width: 26px;
    text-align: center;
    color: #061b30;
    height: 28px;
    line-height: 23px;
    float: right;
    margin-left: 5px;
    margin-bottom: 6px;
    cursor: pointer;
    text-align: center;
    font-weight: bold;
    float: right;
    font-size: 22px;
    padding: 0 4px;
    border-radius: 21px;
}
.TourList .TourInfo {
    margin-left: 0;
    padding: 0 0px 20px 20px;
    background-color: white;
    overflow: hidden;
}
.tour-overview p, .tour-collection p {
    text-align: justify;
}
.TourList::after {
    content: '';
    position: absolute;
    width: 18px;
    height: 18px;
    left: -11px;
    background-color: white;
    border: 2px solid #061b30;
    top: 0px;
    border-radius: 50%;
    z-index: 1;
}
.tour-collection {
    float: left;
    width: 100%;
}

.sidebar_section_col, .sidebar_section_col2 {
    margin: 0 0 15px 0;
    background: #fff;
	-webkit-box-shadow: 0 1px 5px 0 rgb(0 0 0 / 30%);
    box-shadow: 0 1px 5px 0 rgb(0 0 0 / 30%);
    margin-top: 20px;
}
.sidebar_section_col h3, .sidebar_section_col2 h3, .sidebar_section_col div {
    font-size: 20px;
    color: #fff;
    background: #061b30;
    margin: 0;
    padding: 10px;
    font-family: 'Roboto';
    font-weight: bold;
}
.sidebar_section_col ul li a {
    color: #000;
    padding: 6px 10px;
    display: block;
    text-decoration: none;
    font-size: 16px;
}
.sidebar_section_col ul li i {
    padding-right: 5px;

    font-weight: bold;
}
.sidebar_section_col ul li.morepkg {

}

    color: #c00100;
    text-align: right;
    font-weight: bold;
}

.sidebar_section_col ul li:before {
    display: none;
}
.sidebar_section_col ul li {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0px;
    list-style: none;
    border-bottom: 1px dotted #d8d7d4;
}

.TourDates p {
    font-weight: bold;
}

.tourbrd a {
    color: #bf000c;
    font-weight: bold;
}
.tour-collection .table-responsive {
    min-height: .01%;
    overflow-x: auto;
}
.tour-collection table {
    width: 100%;
    background: #9e9e9e54;
}
.tour-collection .table-newbg table tr {
    background-color: #fef2b8;
    border: none !important;
}
.tour-collection .table-newbg table th {
    font-size: 14px;
    color: #fff !important;
    text-align: center !important;
    padding-top: 6px !important;
    padding-bottom: 6px !important;
    background-color: #061b30;
    border: none !important;
}
.tour-collection .table-newbg table td {
    padding-top: 5px !important;
    padding-bottom: 5px !important;
    text-align: center !important;
    font-size: 14px;
    border: none !important;
	font-family: 'Roboto';
	font-weight: bold;
}

.pkg-inc ul li,.pkg-exc ul li {
    padding: 7px 0px 7px 22px !important;
    list-style: none;
    background: url(/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/inc.jpg) no-repeat left;
}

.pkg-inc ul li:before,.pkg-exc ul li:before {

}
.pkg-exc ul li {

<div class="custom_html">
<div class="tourbrd">
<h1>Japan Korea Taiwan Tour Package</h1>
<p><span><a href="/" title="Home">Home</a> » <a href="/international-tours" title="International Tour Packages">International</a> » <a href="/japan-tour-packages" title="Japan Tour Packages">Japan</a> » <span class="breadcrumb_last" aria-current="page">Japan Korea Taiwan Tour Package</span></span></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="cmsmasters_row_673c31ec866495_28028078" class="cmsmasters_row cmsmasters_color_scheme_default tourflexBox cmsmasters_row_top_default cmsmasters_row_bot_default cmsmasters_row_boxed">
<div id="tourflexBox2" class="cmsmasters_row_outer_parent">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_outer">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_inner">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_margin">
<div class="cmsmasters_column two_third">
<div class="custom_html tourIB1">
<div class="proGall"><img decoding="async" src="/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/japan-korea.jpg" alt="Japan Korea Taiwan Tour Package" title="Japan Korea Taiwan Tour Package" width="750" height="450" loading="lazy"></div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB2">
<div class="tour-overview">
<div class="toBt"><i class="fa fa-file"></i> Tour Overview</div>
<p>Explore the wonderful, unique and exotic destinations of Japan Korea and Taiwan, an ideal choice for a family vacation. From exploring the culture of these places to tasting the traditional food and cuisines here to further exploring its skyscrapers this place is undoubtedly any traveller’s dream come true. The experience here will be unparalleled to anywhere else and you will feel like exploring more. Book this Japan, Korea and Taiwan tour package at the best available prices and have the holiday of a lifetime.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB4">
<div class="tour-collection">
<h2 class="tourDBox"><i class="fa fa-bus" aria-hidden="true"></i> Japan Korea Taiwan Tour Itinerary Package</h2>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details" id="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 1 :</span>Arrival in Taipei</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo">
<p>On reaching Taipei (capital of Taiwan) our tour representatives will greet and receive you at the airport. You will be transferred to your allotted hotel here. En route you will be made to visit the famous Taipei 101 – the 2nd tallest skyscrapers in the world. You will be made to take a grand and majestic view from its observatory deck on the 89th floor. After spending a thrilling time here you will be made to head to your hotel where you will be staying the night.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 2 :</span>Taipei – Sun Moon Lake – Taichung</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>After having a delicious breakfast meal to start off your day you will be made to head out for your visit to the sun moon lake. You will be taken on a cruise ride in this lake along with visiting Wen Wu temple. You will also be made to enjoy the fun ride on the ropeway and obtain a bird’s eye view of the place. You will then be made to leave for Taichung. On reaching you will be made to visit the famous Fengjia night market – the largest night market in Taiwan, before heading on to your hotel for a night stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 3 :</span>Taichung – Taipei</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>After having your breakfast early in the morning you will be made to proceed on for your next destination of Taipei. On your way you will be visiting the famous rainbow village. On reaching Taipei you will be taken on a brief sightseeing tour of famous tourist places here like Chiang Kai-shek Memorial for witnessing the unique guard changing ceremony. You will then be made to visit the national palace museum famous for its Chinese artifacts, artworks etc. finally you will reach your hotel and stay there for the night.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 4 & 5 & 6 :</span>Taipei – Seoul</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>After your breakfast in the morning, you will be taken to your next destination in Seoul. On reaching Seoul you will be made to head for your hotel where you will be staying for the duration of your stay here i.e. 2 days.</p>
<p>You will be visiting a number of interesting tourist attractions in Seoul like – Seoul Tower, Cheongwadae, Gyeongbokgung Palace, COFX Aquarium, Dorasan Peace Park, Dora Observatory, the 3rd tunnel etc. you will also be taken to explore the vibrant and fun-filled safari world. This will take 2 whole days for you to visit some of the top tourist destinations here. The best part is that every place here has its own significance and importance making it more relevant.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 7 :</span>Seoul – Osaka</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>After your breakfast in the morning, you will be transferred to your departure location at the airport from where you will be boarding the flight headed for Osaka. On reaching there our tour representative there will get you checked in to your allotted hotel here where you will be spending the night. The remainder of the day will be free for you to indulge in your leisurely activities.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 8 :</span>Seoul – Nara – Kyoto – Osaka</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>After your breakfast in the morning, you will be made to proceed for a visit to Osaka castle then head on for a visit to the famous and grand Nara deer park and visit the famous Todaiji Temple (a UNESCO world heritage site) here. you will then be driven to your next destination in Kyoto where you will be visiting the famous golden pavilion and Kiyomizu Temple etc. finally from here, you will be made to head on for Osaka, where you will be checked in to your hotel where you will be spending the night.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 9 :</span>Osaka – Hiroshima</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>After your breakfast in the morning, you will be made to proceed for your next destination of Hiroshima. On entering Hiroshima you will be made to visit the famous tourist destination of bomb dome and Sadako monument that reflects the true spirit of the people of Hiroshima. Before heading on for your hotel you will be visiting the famous Hiroshima history museum and peace park here. You will be spending the night in Hiroshima.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 10 :</span>Hiroshima – Tokyo</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>Early in the morning after breakfast, you will be taken on a bullet train ride heading for Tokyo. On reaching Tokyo you will be transferred to your hotel here and the remainder of the day will be free for you to indulge in leisurely activities. You will be staying the night in the hotel here.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 11 :</span>Sightseeing of Tokyo</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>After having your breakfast in the morning you will be made to head on for a visit to the famous Yamashita Park and royal park tower, especially during the wisteria bloom season in mid-April and mid-May. You will then be made to visit the palette town, Toyota mega web and Venus Fort. Later on, you will be passing the famous rainbow bridge. After this the itinerary will take you to your next location of Asakusa Temple Complex, Shopping in Nakamise arcade and to end the day a rejuvenating time at Shinjuku garden. Your day will end by a visit to the famous Tokyo tower and observe the world from above.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 12 :</span>Tokyo Departure</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>After having your breakfast in the morning you will be made to head for your departure location at the airport in Tokyo. This will mark the end of your Japan tour package with us and we hope that you have a safe journey to your next desired destination.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="custom_html tourIB8">
<div id="popularBox8" class="tour-collection">
<h3><i class="fa fa-question-circle" aria-hidden="true"></i> FAQs for Japan Korea Taiwan Package</h3>
<div class="panel-body">
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Can We Take A Train From Japan To Korea?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Take a train across Japan to Hakata-Fukuoka or Shimonoseki. Hakata is the terminus of the high-speed Shinkansen line from Tokyo, Kyoto, Osaka, and Hiroshima; for train times and fares within Japan.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Which Months Are The Best To Visit Japan And South Korea?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> The spring months of April, May, and June, as well as the autumn months of September, October, and November, are generally regarded as the best times of year to visit South Korea. Days are typically sunny and dry during these two seasons, with comfortable average temperatures.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> When Is The Best Time To Visit Taiwan?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> In terms of weather, September to November are considered the best months to visit Taiwan. This season provides the ideal balance of cool and dry weather. The south remains warm for the majority of September, but temperatures in northern Taiwan begin to cool, though they remain pleasant.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Makes Japanese Cuisine Unique?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Japanese cuisine has long been admired for its innovative flavours, unique ingredients, and distinct sense of culture and history. Through the creative use of ingredients, the best Japanese food tells a story, transforming the dining experience into something both enjoyable and eye-opening.</p>
</p></div></div></div></div></div>
</div>
</div>

		<p><span id="wpcf7-673c31ec87bfe-wrapper" class="wpcf7-form-control-wrap website_fill-wrap" style="display:none !important; visibility:hidden !important;"><label for="wpcf7-673c31ec87bfe-field" class="hp-message">Please leave this field empty.</label><input id="wpcf7-673c31ec87bfe-field"  class="wpcf7-form-control wpcf7-text" type="text" name="website_fill" value="" size="40" tabindex="-1" autocomplete="new-password" /></span><span class="wpcf7-form-control-wrap" data-name="your-name"><input size="40" maxlength="400" class="wpcf7-form-control wpcf7-text wpcf7-validates-as-required" aria-required="true" aria-invalid="false" placeholder="Full Name*" value="" type="text" name="your-name" /></span><span class="wpcf7-form-control-wrap" data-name="your-email"><input size="40" maxlength="400" class="wpcf7-form-control wpcf7-email wpcf7-validates-as-required wpcf7-text wpcf7-validates-as-email" aria-required="true" aria-invalid="false" placeholder="Email Id*" value="" type="email" name="your-email" /></span>
		</p>
		<p class="sCntry"><span class="wpcf7-form-control-wrap your-country"><input class="wpcf7-form-control wpcf7-intl_tel wpcf7-intl-tel" aria-invalid="false" placeholder="in" data-initialcountry="in" data-preferredcountries="gb-in" value="" type="tel" name="your-country-cf7it-national" /><input name="your-country" type="hidden" class="wpcf7-intl-tel-full" /><input type="hidden" name="your-country-cf7it-country-name" class="wpcf7-intl-tel-country-name" /><input type="hidden" name="your-country-cf7it-country-code" class="wpcf7-intl-tel-country-code" /><input type="hidden" name="your-country-cf7it-country-iso2" class="wpcf7-intl-tel-country-iso2" /></span><span class="wpcf7-form-control-wrap" data-name="your-phones"><input size="40" maxlength="400" class="wpcf7-form-control wpcf7-tel wpcf7-validates-as-required wpcf7-text wpcf7-validates-as-tel" aria-required="true" aria-invalid="false" placeholder="10 digit mobile number" value="" type="tel" name="your-phones" /></span>
		</p>
		<p><span class="wpcf7-form-control-wrap" data-name="your-date"><input size="40" maxlength="400" class="wpcf7-form-control wpcf7-text wpcf7-validates-as-required" aria-required="true" aria-invalid="false" placeholder="Time of Travel*" value="" type="text" name="your-date" /></span><span class="wpcf7-form-control-wrap" data-name="your-trMess"><textarea cols="40" rows="10" maxlength="140" class="wpcf7-form-control wpcf7-textarea" aria-invalid="false" placeholder="Write a description of your tour so we can design the best package for you!" name="your-trMess"></textarea></span>
		</p>
		<div>
			<p><button type="submit" class="waves-bxt submitBtn2">SEND ME DETAILS <i class="fa fa-arrow-circle-right"></i></button><br />
<span class="infoBxs">We never share your Information.</span>
			</p>
		</div>
	</div>
</div><div class="wpcf7-response-output" aria-hidden="true"></div>
</form>
</div>
</div>

excerpt.rendered: Japan Korea Taiwan Tour Package Home » International » Japan » Japan Korea Taiwan Tour Package Tour Overview Explore the wonderful, unique and exotic destinations of Japan Korea and Taiwan, an ideal choice for a family vacation. From exploring the culture of these places to tasting the traditional food and cuisines here to further exploring...
